pageContext.claim: “So when we came out 12 down, we actually wrote them legal letters and everything. And then they changed the vote. Can you believe it? They changed it where we were one down. But that was the day before the election. Two weeks to go, 12 down.”
pageContext.analysis: As noted above, this was a tracking poll. Scott Clement, the Washington Post polling director, does not recall receiving any letters from the Trump campaign about the poll. And certainly The Post would not alter the poll in response to any such letter.
